intro: Bunias myagroides, commonly known as field mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has a hairy stem. Its leaves are lobed and have a peppery taste, similar to other members of the mustard family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural settings.
